https://prez.dev/description.@value: A categorization of disciplines or topics that the broad field of Earth science can be subdivided into, i.e. a listing of the Fields of Research, or subjects, to which a geoscience dataset, publication, observation/activity, or entity pertains. The vocabulary also contains relevant disciplines that intersect with the various Earth science fields, such as biological sciences and built environment and design, as well as entries related to collection and heritage management. Notations included are those from the 2020 ANZSRC listing (see History Note) or in common use in the geoscience community.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: The mineralogical study of specific geographic regions, from ore deposits clusters to large metallogenic provinces. It includes evaluation of location and the spatial distribution of minerals and mineral assemblages in relation to the geological history of the province (region) or the formation of the deposit. Regional mineralogy can include mineral regional fingerprinting, and directly links to metallogeny and genetic mineralogy.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value: Compiled by the Geological Survey of Western Australia based on the Lomonosov-Fund website from Moscow State University.
